title: History IM definitions
$comments: Part of PROC component, latest version.

TASK_PLAN_EXECUTION_HISTORY.title: TASK_PLAN_EXECUTION_HISTORY
TASK_PLAN_EXECUTION_HISTORY.description:
History of Task Plan execution events and notifications. May be used by a workflow application to record all events during execution.

May be persisted in the EHR in partial or complete form, or not at all.

plan_events.description: Execution time events that occurred at the Task Plan level, i.e. not to a particular task. These include events such as Task Plan abandonment.

EVENT_RECORD.title: EVENT_RECORD
EVENT_RECORD.description: Abstract parent of types representing execution time events on a Task Plan.

description.description: Optional description associated with the event. Would typically be populated for Cancel and Abort events.

TASK_NOTIFICATION_RECORD.title: TASK_NOTIFICATION_RECORD
TASK_NOTIFICATION_RECORD.description: Record of a notification to another party (i.e. performer).

details.description: Other details as a name/value list.

TASK_PLAN_EVENT_RECORD.title: TASK_PLAN_EVENT_RECORD
TASK_PLAN_EVENT_RECORD.description: Record of an runtime event to a Task Plan, including abandonment, performer allocation and re-allocation and so on.
TASK_PLAN_EVENT_RECORD.$comments: Defined in History IM, inherits from EVENT_RECORD

description.description: Optional description associated with the event. Would typically be populated for Cancel and Abort events.

details.description: Other details as a name/value list.

TASK_EVENT_RECORD.title: TASK_EVENT_RECORD
TASK_EVENT_RECORD.description: Record of an event for a single Task. Records task identifier, time, resulting lifecycle state and optional reason.
TASK_EVENT_RECORD.$comments: Defined in History IM, inherits from EVENT_RECORD

description.description: Optional description associated with the event. Would typically be populated for Cancel and Abort events.

task_id.description: Identification of Task in the Task Plan structre using a path of the form `/task_group_id/task_group_id`.

lifecycle_state.description: The lifecycle state that was reached due to this event.

notifications_sent.description: Notifications that were performed as part of this Task Event.

entry_instances.description: Forward references to Entry (e.g. `ACTION`, `OBSERVATION` etc) that was recorded as a result of this Task being performed. If this is set, it indicates that the planned Task is 'done' i.e. checked off the plan.

preconditions_satisfied.description: Set to True if all preconditions defined on the corresponding Task were satisfied at runtime. If set to False, and there were preconditions, this means that preconditions were overridden by the user at runtime.

wait_conditions_satisfied.description: Set to True if all wait_conditions for the corresponding Task were satisfied when it was performed. If False, and there were wait_conditions, wait_conditions were overridden by the user at runtime.
